sentiment_score_definition: x <= -0.35: Bearish; -0.35 < x <= -0.15: Somewhat-Bearish; -0.15 < x < 0.15: Neutral; 0.15 <= x < 0.35: Somewhat_Bullish; x >= 0.35: Bullish
relevance_score_definition: 0 < x <= 1, with a higher score indicating higher relevance.

feed.title: Stardust Power Raises $15M to Advance Preconstruction Work at Okla. Lithium Refinery
feed.summary: Stardust Power Inc. has secured up to $15 million in convertible debt financing to fund preconstruction work for its planned lithium refinery in Muskogee, Oklahoma. The funding will support engineering and procurement activities as the company pursues state permits and secures full project-level construction financing. The facility aims to produce 50,000 metric tons per year of battery-grade lithium carbonate, addressing a critical need for domestic lithium refining capacity.

feed.title: New to The Street Show #694 to Broadcast Tonight at 6:30 PM EST as Sponsored Programming on Bloomberg TV Featuring Stardust Power (NASDAQ:SDST), Spartan Equipment, Roadzen (NASDAQ:RDZN), Aeries Technology (NASDAQ:AERT), and XION
feed.summary: New to The Street announces its 694th episode will air tonight at 6:30 PM EST on Bloomberg Television, featuring companies like Stardust Power (NASDAQ:SDST), Spartan Equipment, Roadzen (NASDAQ:RDZN), Aeries Technology (NASDAQ:AERT), and XION. The program provides a platform for companies to share their innovations and growth strategies with a wide audience. Sponsored commercials during the show include Acurx Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ACXP), Synergy CHC (NASDAQ:SNYR), The Sustainable Green Team (OTC:SGTM), and PetVivo Holdings (OTCQB:PETV).

feed.title: New Oklahoma lithium refinery moves closer to construction after $15M deal
feed.summary: Stardust Power (NASDAQ: SDST) has secured up to $15.0 million in senior secured convertible debt to fund the early-stage construction of its lithium refinery in Muskogee, Oklahoma. This financing includes an initial $4.0 million drawdown and will support engineering, infrastructure, and procurement activities. The company aims to build a 50,000 metric ton per annum refinery and views this as bridge financing while pursuing additional asset-level equity and debt.

feed.title: Stardust Power secures up to $15 million in convertible debt financing
feed.summary: Stardust Power Inc. secured up to $15 million in senior secured convertible debt financing from an institutional investor to fund early-stage construction of its lithium refinery project in Muskogee, Oklahoma. This financing is crucial as the company faces short-term obligations exceeding liquid assets, although it holds more cash than debt. The funds will support detailed engineering, infrastructure, and procurement, with analysts showing optimism for the company's future despite past stock volatility.

feed.title: Stardust Power stock falls after announcing convertible debt financing
feed.summary: Stardust Power Inc. (NASDAQ:SDST) stock fell 3.5% after announcing it secured up to $15 million in convertible debt financing to fund early-stage construction activities at its Oklahoma refinery project. This financing, structured as senior secured convertible debt with an initial $4 million drawdown, will support engineering, infrastructure, and procurement. The company views this as bridge financing to minimize public equity dilution and maximize shareholder value while pursuing project-level construction financing.

feed.title: Stardust Power secures financing for Oklahoma lithium refinery
feed.summary: Stardust Power (SDST) has successfully secured up to $15 million in senior secured convertible debt financing to fund the early-stage construction of its lithium refinery project in Muskogee, Oklahoma. This financing includes an initial $4 million drawdown, providing flexible capital for detailed engineering, infrastructure, and procurement. The company plans to fund the main construction through asset-level equity and debt, aiming to minimize public equity dilution and maximize shareholder value.

feed.title: Stardust Power secures up to $15 million in convertible debt financing
feed.summary: Stardust Power Inc. has secured up to $15 million in senior secured convertible debt financing to fund early construction activities at its lithium refinery project in Muskogee, Oklahoma. This financing, which includes an initial $4 million drawdown, comes at a critical time for the company which faces short-term obligations exceeding liquid assets. Despite past volatility and recent losses, analysts are optimistic about Stardust Power's prospects, with price targets suggesting significant upside potential.

feed.title: Stardust Power secures financing to advance Oklahoma lithium refinery toward construction
feed.summary: Stardust Power Inc. has secured up to $15 million in senior secured convertible debt financing to advance its lithium refinery project in Muskogee, Oklahoma. This funding will support early-stage construction, engineering, infrastructure, and procurement activities. The company aims to fund the full construction of its 50,000 metric ton per annum refinery through a combination of asset-level equity and debt, minimizing public equity dilution.

feed.title: Stardust Power Inc. Secures $15 Million in Convertible Debt Financing for Lithium Refinery Project in Oklahoma
feed.summary: Stardust Power Inc. has secured up to $15 million in senior secured convertible debt financing to advance the early-stage construction of its lithium refinery project in Muskogee, Oklahoma. This funding, which includes an immediate $4 million drawdown, will support detailed engineering, infrastructure preparation, and procurement activities. The financing offers a 24-month term with an initial repayment moratorium, providing flexibility to repay in cash or stock, and is intended to bridge to larger project-level financing.

feed.title: Stardust Power Secures Financing To Advance Oklahoma Lithium Refinery Toward Construction
feed.summary: Stardust Power Inc. secured up to $15.0 million in senior secured convertible debt financing from an institutional investor to fund early-stage construction activities for its lithium refinery project in Muskogee, Oklahoma. This financing includes an initial $4.0 million drawdown, providing flexible capital for detailed engineering, infrastructure, and procurement. The company aims to minimize public equity dilution and maximize shareholder value as it moves towards project-level construction financing.

feed.title: Stardust Power Secures Financing To Advance Oklahoma Lithium Refinery Toward Construction
feed.summary: Stardust Power Inc. announced it has secured up to $15.0 million in senior secured convertible debt financing from a single institutional investor. This funding, which includes an initial $4.0 million drawdown, will support early-stage construction activities for its lithium refinery project in Muskogee, Oklahoma. The financing will enable detailed engineering, infrastructure, and procurement as the company moves towards construction, with Roshan Pujari, CEO, highlighting the focus on a flexible capital stack.

feed.title: SDST SEC Filings - Stardust Power Inc 10-K, 10-Q, 8-K Forms
feed.summary: This page provides a comprehensive resource for Stardust Power Inc. (SDST) SEC filings, including annual, quarterly, and material event reports, utilizing AI for simplified analysis. Recent filings highlight the company's shift to the Nasdaq Capital Market, warrant cancellations, new share issuances, and ongoing delisting notices and plans. The article also details a significant non-binding letter of intent with Prairie Lithium for a long-term lithium supply agreement.

feed.title: Stardust Power expects 2026 to be a “pivotal” year
feed.summary: Stardust Power, a lithium developer in Muskogee, Oklahoma, anticipates 2026 will be a pivotal year as it progresses toward full construction of the nation's largest battery-grade lithium refinery. The company secured key permits and financing in the past year, completing significant milestones like independent engineering reports and initial earthworks. These achievements position the project for execution and delivery in the coming year.

feed.title: Stardust Power Ends Stock Purchase Agreement
feed.summary: Stardust Power Inc. has terminated its stock purchase agreement with B. Riley Principal Capital II, LLC, as of December 11, 2025, to pursue more flexible and non-dilutive financing options. The termination includes a make-whole payment from Stardust Power and is intended to realign its funding strategy. Stardust Power stock (SDST) currently holds a Buy rating from analysts with a $9.00 price target, although TipRanks' AI Analyst, Spark, rates it as an Underperform due to poor financial performance and lack of market momentum.

feed.title: Stardust Power (NASDAQ: SDST) completes review of Muskogee lithium project
feed.summary: Stardust Power Inc. (NASDAQ: SDST) announced that an independent engineering firm, Black & Veatch, completed a review of the Front-End Loading 3 (FEL 3) study for its Muskogee lithium carbonate refinery project. The review affirmed that the project's technical and design assumptions align with proven industry standards and that initial production targets are achievable. This assessment provides technical support for the planned facility's design and feasibility.

feed.title: Stardust Power Inc Completes Independent Review of Muskogee Lithium Refinery
feed.summary: Stardust Power Inc. announced the completion of an independent review of its Muskogee lithium refinery project by Black & Veatch. The review confirmed low technical risk, the achievability of Phase 1 production targets of 25,000 mtpa, and suitability of the Muskogee site with access to essential utilities. It also deemed construction, ramp-up schedules, and procurement strategy feasible and aligned with industry standards.

feed.title: Stardust Power Advances Validated Lithium Project in OK
feed.summary: Stardust Power announced the completion of an independent third-party review of its Front-End Loading 3 (FEL 3) engineering study for its planned lithium carbonate refinery in Muskogee, Oklahoma. The review, conducted by Black & Veatch, affirmed the project's suitability, technical feasibility, and alignment with industry standards for constructing a 50,000 metric-ton-per-year lithium carbonate facility. This validation is a significant milestone for the company's commitment to U.S. energy security and industrial resilience.

feed.title: Stardust Power (NASDAQ: SDST) review backs 25,000 mtpa Muskogee lithium plant
feed.summary: Stardust Power (NASDAQ: SDST) announced that Black & Veatch completed an independent engineering "red flag" review of its FEL 3 study for the Muskogee, Oklahoma lithium carbonate refinery. The report found low technical and design risks, validated a Phase 1 target of 25,000 metric tons per annum (mtpa) and a 50,000 mtpa ultimate design, confirming that the 24-month construction and 12-month ramp-up timelines are achievable. This independent validation supports the project's design and execution strategy, underscoring its readiness for further development.

feed.title: Stardust Power Receives Independent Review Of Its Muskogee Lithium Refinery
feed.summary: Stardust Power Inc. announced the completion of an independent third-party review of its Muskogee lithium carbonate refinery project's engineering study. The review, conducted by Black & Veatch, affirmed the project's low technical and design risk, the achievability of Phase 1 production targets, and its alignment with industry practices. This validation marks a significant milestone, de-risking the project and positioning Stardust Power to advance toward construction of its 50,000 metric-ton-per-annum facility.

feed.title: Black & Veatch review validates Stardust Power’s lithium refinery plans
feed.summary: Stardust Power Inc. announced that an independent review by Black & Veatch has validated the technical feasibility of its planned lithium carbonate refinery in Muskogee, Oklahoma. The review deemed the project to have "low technical and design risk" and confirmed the achievability of Phase 1 production targets, with the Muskogee site being suitable due to its access to essential infrastructure. This validation marks a significant step for Stardust Power in advancing its plans to produce battery-grade lithium carbonate for U.S. energy security.

feed.title: Stardust Power receives independent review of Muskogee Lithium Refinery
feed.summary: Stardust Power (SDST) announced an independent third-party review by Black & Veatch of its Front-End Loading 3 engineering study for its lithium carbonate refinery project in Muskogee, Oklahoma. The review validated the project's design, confirming it is based on proven lithium processing systems with modifications for wider feedstock handling and efficient recovery. This assessment indicated a low technology risk, reinforcing the technical integrity and feasibility of Stardust Power's approach.

feed.title: Stardust Power Receives Independent Review Of Its Muskogee Lithium Refinery
feed.summary: Stardust Power Inc. announced that an independent third-party review by Black & Veatch has validated its Front-End Loading 3 engineering study for its Muskogee lithium carbonate refinery project. The review affirmed that the project's design meets industry standards, has low technical risk, and that Phase 1 production targets are achievable. This milestone reinforces the project's technical integrity and feasibility, positioning Stardust Power to advance toward major construction for domestic battery-grade lithium carbonate production.

feed.title: Stardust Power Receives Independent Review Of Its Muskogee Lithium Refinery
feed.summary: Stardust Power announced that an independent review by Black & Veatch affirmed its Muskogee lithium refinery meets industry standards, validating the project's technical integrity and feasibility. The review found low technical and design risk, with Phase 1 production targets deemed achievable and the site suitable. This milestone advances the project towards construction, reinforcing confidence for investors and stakeholders.

feed.title: Stardust Power Nears Construction Start in Muskogee
feed.summary: Stardust Power Inc. is nearing a final investment decision for its lithium processing plant in Muskogee, Oklahoma, after completing FEL-3 engineering and securing initial supply agreements. The company reported being debt-free with $1.6 million in cash and improved its net loss to $4.5 million in Q3 2025, from over $10 million in the prior year. This progress positions Stardust Power to become a major U.S. source of battery-grade lithium with a 24-month construction timeline and estimated CapEx of $500 million.

feed.title: Stardust Power Inc. SEC 10-Q Report
feed.summary: Stardust Power Inc. has released its Q3 2025 10-Q report, detailing improved financial performance with reduced net losses and enhanced cost management. The company, now publicly traded on Nasdaq, is focused on developing a lithium refinery in Oklahoma to support U.S. energy independence. Strategic investments and business combinations position Stardust Power for future growth, though significant capital raising will be needed for continued operations.

feed.title: Earnings call transcript: Stardust Power Q3 2025 sees stock volatility amid lithium expansion
feed.summary: Stardust Power (SDST) reported a challenging Q3 2025 with a $4.5 million net loss ($64.6 million accumulated deficit), but outlined ambitious lithium expansion plans, including a Muskogee refinery aiming for 50,000 metric tons of battery-grade lithium carbonate. The stock experienced significant volatility, dropping 14.52% before rebounding 2.72% in aftermarket trading. The company emphasized its strategic positioning in the growing lithium market, securing feedstock agreements, and advancing its refinery project despite not relying on government funding for profitability.

feed.title: Stardust Power Announces Q3 2025 Financial Results
feed.summary: Stardust Power Inc. announced its Q3 2025 financial results, highlighting key operational achievements including the completion of an FEL-3 engineering report for its Muskogee lithium refinery, securing initial feedstock agreements, and regaining full Nasdaq listing compliance. The company reported a reduced net loss of $4.5 million and improved net loss per share of $(0.53) for the quarter, while remaining debt-free. These advancements bring Stardust Power closer to the final investment decision and construction start of the refinery, aiming to establish a major U.S. source of battery-grade lithium.

feed.title: Stardust Power Inc. Reports Third Quarter 2025 Results and Progress on Muskogee Lithium Refinery Project
feed.summary: Stardust Power Inc. announced its Q3 2025 results, highlighting significant progress on its Muskogee lithium refinery project, including the completion of its FEL-3 engineering report with reduced capital expenditures. The company also reported regaining Nasdaq compliance, securing feedstock supply agreements, and a reduced net loss, indicating improved financial performance and operational advancement.

feed.title: Stardust Power Inc. to Release Q3 2025 Financial Results on November 13, 2025
feed.summary: Stardust Power Inc. announced it will release its Q3 2025 financial results on November 13, 2025, after market close, followed by a conference call hosted by CEO Roshan Pujari and CFO Uday Devasper. The company, which is developing a battery-grade lithium carbonate refinery in Muskogee, Oklahoma, focuses on enhancing U.S. energy security and is listed on NASDAQ under the ticker "SDST." Investors can track insider and institutional trading activity related to SDST via Quiver Quantitative.

feed.title: Stardust Power Announces Third Quarter 2025 Earnings Release Date, Conference Call
feed.summary: Stardust Power Inc. announced its third-quarter 2025 financial results will be released after market close on Thursday, November 13, 2025. A conference call with CEO Roshan Pujari and CFO Uday Devasper will be held to discuss the results on the same day at 5:30 PM ET. The company provided details for participants to register for the call and access the live audio webcast.

feed.title: Stardust Power (NASDAQ: SDST) enters LOI for 7,500 tpa LCE from Mandrake, up to 18 years
feed.summary: Stardust Power (NASDAQ: SDST) has signed a non-binding Letter of Intent with Mandrake Resources to secure 7,500 metric tons per annum of lithium chloride (LCE) from Mandrake’s Utah Lithium Project for its Muskogee, Oklahoma refinery. This agreement, initially for 12 years with an optional 6-year extension, aims to strengthen the U.S. lithium supply chain and support Stardust Power's Final Investment Decision and financing options. Mandrake's Utah project boasts an Inferred Resource of 3.3 million tonnes LCE, with both companies highlighting the strategic alignment and benefits of a centralized refinery model and a reliable domestic feedstock.

feed.title: Stardust Power Inc. Achieves Compliance with Nasdaq Listing Requirements
feed.summary: Stardust Power Inc. has confirmed compliance with Nasdaq listing requirements as of October 28, 2025, leading to the cancellation of a previously scheduled appeal hearing. The company's common stock and warrants will continue trading under "SDST" and "SDSTW." Stardust Power is advancing its plans to construct one of America's largest lithium refineries in Muskogee, Oklahoma, aiming to produce up to 50,000 metric tons of battery-grade lithium carbonate annually to enhance energy security.

feed.summary: New to The Street will broadcast its 694th episode on Bloomberg Television tonight at 6:30 PM EST. The episode will feature Stardust Power (NASDAQ:SDST), Spartan Equipment, Roadzen (NASDAQ: RDZN), Aeries Technology (NASDAQ: AERT), and XION, highlighting their innovations and growth strategies. The program, which also airs on Fox Business, continues to offer significant exposure to companies through its combined media platforms.

feed.title: New to The Street Show #694 to Broadcast Tonight at 6:30 PM EST as Sponsored Programming on Bloomberg TV Featuring Stardust Power (NASDAQ:SDST), Spartan Equipment, Roadzen (NASDAQ:RDZN), Aeries Technology (NASDAQ:AERT), and XION - The Providence Journal
feed.summary: New to The Street will broadcast its 694th episode on Bloomberg Television tonight at 6:30 PM EST, featuring Stardust Power (NASDAQ:SDST), Spartan Equipment, Roadzen (NASDAQ:RDZN), Aeries Technology (NASDAQ:AERT), and XION. The program showcases these companies' innovations and growth strategies to a wide U.S. audience. Sponsored commercials from companies like Acurx Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ: ACXP) and Synergy CHC (NASDAQ:SNYR) will also be included.

feed.title: Update on environmental cleanup at former tire plant - Oklahoma Energy Today
feed.summary: A public meeting is scheduled in Miami, Oklahoma, to provide updates on the environmental cleanup at the former BF Goodrich tire plant. DEQ officials and representatives from Michelin North America, Inc. will discuss groundwater remediation efforts, particularly concerning benzene contamination, and address community concerns regarding transparency and long-term monitoring.

feed.title: Stardust Power Inc. Appoints Kenneth Pitts as Construction and Subcontracts Director - MarketScreener
feed.summary: Stardust Power Inc. has appointed Kenneth Pitts as its Construction and Subcontracts Director, based in Houston, Texas. Mr. Pitts will oversee the execution of major onsite projects at the company's Muskogee, Oklahoma refinery, managing construction operations and subcontract portfolios to ensure projects are delivered safely, on schedule, on budget, and within technical parameters. This appointment is a significant step towards commencing Phase 1 construction of the Muskogee Project and leverages Mr. Pitts' extensive experience in large-scale industrial initiatives across various sectors.

feed.title: Stardust Power appoints Kenneth Pitts as construction director By Investing.com - Investing.com Canada
feed.summary: The article reports that Stardust Power has appointed Kenneth Pitts as its construction director. However, due to a client-side exception, the full content of the news article is unavailable. The page shows an application error instead of the expected content.

feed.title: Stardust Power appoints Kenneth Pitts as construction director By Investing.com - Investing.com UK
feed.summary: The article reports that Stardust Power has appointed Kenneth Pitts as its new Construction Director. No further details about Pitts' background, the implications of his appointment, or Stardust Power's activities are available in the provided content due to an application error.

feed.title: Stardust Power Strengthens Construction Team with Ken Pitts - Bluefield Daily Telegraph
feed.summary: Stardust Power Inc. (NASDAQ: SDST) has appointed Kenneth Pitts as Construction and Subcontracts Director, based in Houston, Texas. Mr. Pitts will oversee major onsite projects at the Muskogee, Oklahoma refinery, managing construction operations and subcontract portfolios to ensure projects are delivered safely, on schedule, on budget, and within technical parameters. His appointment signifies meaningful progress toward commencing Phase 1 construction and strengthens the company's transition from a development company to an operating company.

feed.title: Head to Head Survey: Hoya (OTCMKTS:HOCPY) and Stardust Power (NASDAQ:SDST) - Defense World
feed.summary: This article provides a head-to-head comparison of Hoya and Stardust Power across several financial and business metrics. Hoya shows stronger revenue, earnings, and profitability, while Stardust Power has higher institutional and insider ownership and a more favorable analyst rating with significant upside potential.

feed.title: Stardust Power Announces Reverse Stock Split to Regain Nasdaq Compliance and Position for Long-Term Growth
feed.summary: Stardust Power Inc. announced a 1-for-10 reverse stock split, effective September 8, 2025, to regain Nasdaq compliance and attract institutional investors. This strategic move aims to strengthen the company's capital market access and support the development of its U.S. lithium refining project in Muskogee, Oklahoma, by advancing engineering, permitting, and financing milestones. The company emphasized that this action is not a reflection of its fundamentals but a measure to ensure its equity remains accessible to a broader universe of long-only institutional investors, which remains central to its long-term strategy of funding and advancing its battery-grade lithium refining project.

feed.title: Stardust Power Announces Second Quarter 2025 Earnings Release Date, Conference Call
feed.summary: Stardust Power Inc. (NASDAQ: SDST) announced it will release its second quarter 2025 financial results after market close on Wednesday, August 13, 2025. CEO Roshan Pujari and CFO Uday Devasper will host a conference call at 5:30 PM ET on the same day to discuss the results. Participants can register online for dial-in information or access a live audio webcast.

feed.title: Lithium developer buys site for plant in Muskogee
feed.summary: Stardust Power Inc., a lithium battery developer, has acquired a 66-acre site in Muskogee, Oklahoma, to construct one of North America's largest lithium refineries. This acquisition, coupled with key permitting, allows the company to begin construction and move closer to its goal of becoming a leading supplier of American battery-grade lithium. The project is expected to create hundreds of jobs and benefits from Muskogee's central location, robust logistics, and a $27 million Tax Increment Financing district for infrastructure improvements.

feed.title: Stardust Power Acquires Site, Receives Key Permit And Receives Approval For Major Construction To Commence
feed.summary: Stardust Power Inc. (NASDAQ: SDST) has completed the acquisition of a 66-acre site in Muskogee, Oklahoma, and received a key General Permit for Stormwater Discharges, paving the way for construction of one of North America's largest lithium refineries. This milestone, contingent on finalizing project financing, significantly advances the company's mission to onshore manufacturing of battery-grade lithium for US energy independence. The company credits extensive support from Oklahoma state and local entities for its progress.

feed.title: Stardust Power looks to break ground on Muskogee refinery in early 2025
feed.summary: Stardust Power Inc. has acquired a 66-acre site in Muskogee for its lithium refinery and plans to break ground in Q1 2025. The company highlights the strategic location, support from local and state officials, and a $27 million Tax Increment Financing district for infrastructure improvements. Despite a recent drop in lithium-ion battery cell prices, CEO Roshan Pujari believes prices are rebounding and the company's business plan is robust.

feed.title: Stardust Power Inc (NASDAW: SDST) engages Primero for work on lithium refinery in Oklahoma
feed.summary: Stardust Power Inc has engaged Primero, a multidisciplinary engineering firm, to conduct a front-end loaded level 3 (FEL-3) engineering design and cost study for its lithium refinery in Muskogee, Oklahoma. This study is a critical step towards establishing a clear cost basis for the project and exploring financing options for the refinery, which aims to produce high-quality, battery-grade lithium products. Primero's expertise in lithium projects, including recent engineering achievements for refineries in Texas and North Carolina, positions Stardust Power to advance its plans for major construction.

feed.title: Stardust Power Closes Business Combination and Set to Begin Trading on Nasdaq
feed.summary: Stardust Power Inc. announced the completion of its business combination with Global Partner Acquisition Corp II, allowing it to begin trading on Nasdaq under the ticker symbols "SDST" and "SDSTW" starting July 9, 2024. This move will support the development of its lithium refinery in Muskogee, Oklahoma, aiming to produce up to 50,000 tonnes per annum of battery-grade lithium. This milestone is expected to strengthen America's energy leadership and build resilient supply chains for critical materials.
